meanings.definition: To charge with an excessive amount of energy or power.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic will supercharge the car engine for better performance.
meanings.sent2: Adding a turbocharger can supercharge the vehicle's speed.
meanings.sent3: The superhero decided to supercharge his powers to defeat the villain.
meanings.sent4: The new battery will supercharge your phone in no time.
meanings.sent5: The storm seemed to supercharge the atmosphere with electricity.

meanings.definition: To increase the power or efficiency of something.
meanings.sent1: The solar panels will supercharge the energy production of the house.
meanings.sent2: Eating a healthy breakfast can supercharge your day.
meanings.sent3: The coach's motivational speech supercharged the team's performance.
meanings.sent4: The new software update will supercharge your computer's speed.
meanings.sent5: The caffeine in the coffee will supercharge your energy levels.

meanings.definition: To make something more exciting or intense.
meanings.sent1: The fireworks display will supercharge the celebration.
meanings.sent2: The director decided to supercharge the action scenes in the movie.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes supercharged the audience with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The music festival aims to supercharge the crowd with energy.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected plot twist will supercharge the suspense in the story.
